BakeryQuestions.LocalIngredients: Many of the types of clays used by members are made from clay dug in NC. Many of the glazes are hand-made in the potters studios or at Jordan Hall in Cary. Some of the members mix their own clay (e.g. Lisa and Jeff Ross of Piedmont Pottery). Some of the decorative items used in the glazing are recycled (e.g. glass).
BakeryQuestions.MaterialsUsed: Primarily Clay. All functional products are glazed with food safe glazes. Functional pieces and/or decorative items may also include recycled glass, semiprecious stones, metal or wire as part of the piece.

VendorApplication.Description: The Cary Clay Cooperative (CCC) was formed in the fall of 2004 to serve the needs of potters in the Cary, Apex and Morrisville areas of North Carolina. The CCC’s mission is: to actively foster, develop, and advocate support for ceramic arts and artists in our community; to encourage the artistic expression of and foster communication among ceramic artists; to promote awareness and appreciation of ceramic arts through education and interaction with artists, business, education, government, and the citizens of Cary and surrounding areas.
VendorApplication.Name: Cary Clay Cooperative

Products.string: A wide range of handcrafted functional or decorative pottery and jewelry.

Venues.string: The CCC has regular booths supplied to them by the Town of Cary at Spring Daze and at Lazy Daze and has been a member of the Cary Farmer's Market and is a returning member of the WWFM. Individual memebers of the coopertaive sell their works through other venues as well as through CCC events.
